text: Melvin Emery "Mel" Patton (November 16, 1924 - May 9, 2014), nicknamed "World's Fastest Human" and "Pell Mell", was an American track and field athlete. He won two gold medals at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London, England. He was born in Los Angeles, California. Patton died from cancer and diabetes issues on May 9, 2014 in Fallbrook, California, aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Mel Patton at Sports Reference Category:1924 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American sprinters Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles
title: Mel Patton
